content:
Diagnosis:		Papillary thyroid microcarcinoma

Management:		Total thyroidectomy March 2023
		Radioactive iodine ablation May 2023

Histology:		Right lobe 8mm papillary thyroid microcarcinoma
		BRAF V600E positive
		pT1aN0M0

Current situation:	Routine surveillance review

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up today. She is clinically well with no concerning symptoms. Thyroid function tests show good biochemical control on Levothyroxine 125mcg daily. Thyroglobulin remains undetectable at <0.1. Neck examination shows well-healed thyroidectomy scar with no palpable abnormalities. Recent ultrasound neck (15.01.24) shows no evidence of recurrence. The plan is to continue current Levothyroxine dose and arrange routine follow-up in 6 months with repeat TFTs and thyroglobulin.

cancer_timeline.value: Ultrasound neck shows no evidence of recurrence

patient_facts.value: Well-healed thyroidectomy scar with no palpable abnormalities
Thyroid function tests show good biochemical control on Levothyroxine 125mcg daily

status_updates.value: Early stage papillary thyroid microcarcinoma treated with surgery and radioactive iodine. Currently well with no evidence of recurrence on surveillance.
Routine follow-up in 6 months with repeat TFTs and thyroglobulin
